Description: At University of Houston-Clear Lake, the Women's and Gender Studies minor encourages students to analyze the social and cultural construction of gender, the historical experiences of women, and the relationships of gender to other categories of difference such as race, class, sexuality, and nationality. Through an interdisciplinary curriculum grounded in humanities and social sciences courses, students gain the critical tools necessary for understanding how gender affects individuals, shapes social institutions and public policy, and influences diverse cultures around the world. Our curriculum provides students with a broad and inclusive understanding of women's and gender issues and helps them to think critically about complex social problems.

The University of Houston-Clear Lake (UHCL) is a public university located in Pasadena and Houston, Texas, with additional campuses in Pearland and the Texas Medical Center. It is a part of the University of Houston System. The university is situated on a 524-acre nature preserve near the NASA Johnson Space Center. UHCL offers a variety of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs to its student body.
